oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Postcard of Villeneuve-sur-cher
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Major Bernard Edwin Ragland (1894-1963) served in the Dentist Corps and was a member of the Medical Detachment of the 155 Inf. Regt., 39th Div. during World War I. This postcard of Villeneuve-sur-cher, published by Louis-Eugene-Elie Maquaire, shows the village's main street, "La Grand Rue," today known as the Rue de Saint-Florent. Major Ragland has drawn arrows on the postcard to indicate where his dental office and the infirmary were set up.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
